AnatomicalEntity.description: An instance of a GO cellular anatomical entity, a cell type, or gross anatomical structure

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

type.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

type_inferences.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

AnatomicalEntity.title: AnatomicalEntity

AnatomicalPartOfAssociation.description: Connects an anatomical entity (such as a component, cell, or gross anatomical entity) to its parent parts

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

AnatomicalPartOfAssociation.title: AnatomicalPartOfAssociation

BiologicalProcess.description: An instance of a GO biological process

causes.description: Links a subject domain entity (a MA or BP) to an object domain entity by way of an CausesAssociation

happens_during.description: Links a subject domain entity (a MA or BP) to an object domain entity by way of a HappensDuringAssociation

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

occurs_in.description: Links a subject domain entity (a MA or BP) to an object domain entity by way of an OccursInAssociation

type.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

type_inferences.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

BiologicalProcess.title: BiologicalProcess

CausesAssociation.description: An association owned by an upstream MA or BP that connects to a downstream MA or BP. The nature of the causal relationship is indicated with the predicate.

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: This must be drawn from the causal relation hierarchy in RO

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

CausesAssociation.title: CausesAssociation

ChemicalEntity.description: An instance of a chemical entity, as defined in CHEBI, including macromolecules defined in NEO

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

type.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

type_inferences.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

ChemicalEntity.title: ChemicalEntity

DomainElement.description: An element that is part of a GO-CAM model

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

type.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

type_inferences.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

DomainElement.title: DomainElement

Element.description: Base class for any biological entity or activity or process in a GO-CAM model

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

Element.title: Element

EnabledByAssociation.description: Connects an MA to the information biomacromolecule that executes the activity

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

EnabledByAssociation.title: EnabledByAssociation

Evidence.description: An instance of a piece of evidence. Evidence attributes such as type, reference, hang off of here

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

Evidence.title: Evidence

HappensDuringAssociation.description: Connects an MF to a process or phase in which the process occurs

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

HappensDuringAssociation.title: HappensDuringAssociation

HasInputAssociation.description: Connects an MF or BP to its input entity, which may be a chemical entity, an information biomacromolecule, or a larger structure

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

HasInputAssociation.title: HasInputAssociation

InformationBiomacromolecule.description: This class groups gene, gene product (protein on ncRNA), or a macromolecular complex that is capable of carrying out a molecular activity

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

type.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

type_inferences.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

InformationBiomacromolecule.title: InformationBiomacromolecule

MacromoleculeHasPartAssociation.description: Connects a macromolecule (such as a protein complex) to its parts (gene products or chemical entities)

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

MacromoleculeHasPartAssociation.title: MacromoleculeHasPartAssociation

Model.description: A collection of GO-CAM elements and associated metadata. A model combines multiple simple GO annotations into an integrated, semantically precise and computable model of biological function.

biological_process_set.description: All biological process instances that are part of this model

chemical_entity_set.description: All chemical entity instances that are part of this model.

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

information_biomacromolecule_set.description: All information macromolecule instances that are part of this model

molecular_activity_set.description: All molecular activity instances that are part of this model

ontology_class_set.description: All ontology class objects used in this model

Model.title: Model

MolecularActivity.description: An instance of a GO molecular function

causes.description: Links a subject domain entity (a MA or BP) to an object domain entity by way of an CausesAssociation

enabled_by.description: Links a MolecularActivity to the InformationBiomacromolecule by way of a EnabledByAssociation

happens_during.description: Links a subject domain entity (a MA or BP) to an object domain entity by way of a HappensDuringAssociation

has_input.description: Links a MA or BP to its input by way of a HasInputAssociation

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

occurs_in.description: Links a subject domain entity (a MA or BP) to an object domain entity by way of an OccursInAssociation

type.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

type_inferences.description: links a GOCAM element (an OWL individual) to the specific class it instantiates

MolecularActivity.title: MolecularActivity

OccursInAssociation.description: An association owned by a MA or BP that connect to an AE object in which the activity/process is carried out

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

OccursInAssociation.title: OccursInAssociation

category.description: Name of the high level ontology class in which this entity is categorized

id.description: A unique identifier for an element

name.description: A human-readable name for an attribute or entity.

ProcessPartOfAssociation.description: Connects a MA or BP to its parent parts

has_evidence.description: Links an association to evidence for it

predicate.description: A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes.

subject.description: connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object.

ProcessPartOfAssociation.title: ProcessPartOfAssociation

id.description: A unique identifier for an element
